bibl.title: Letter from Frederick A. Miller to Frederick F. Russell, March 19, 1923

div1.p: Miller sends Russell a report on a possible yellow fever outbreak in Colombia.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick A. Miller to Frederick F. Russell, March 19, 1923
div1.opener:
COPY
REPUBLICA DE COLOMBIA
Ministerio de Agricultura y Comercio
Departamento de Uncinariasis
Bogota
March 19, 1923
My dear Dr. Russell:
div1.p:
I am enclosing a report of cases that appear very much like
yellow fever that broke out in Bucaramanga, the capital of the Depart-
ment of Santander.

At the present time the cases are diminishing and there have
been no deaths for over a period of a week.

I regret that the report is so meager, but the facilities
for diagnosis in this country are very limited.
div1.closer:
Respectfully yours, (Signed) Frederick A. Miller Dr. F. F. Russell
61 Broadway
New York City
